perturbation.original_text: 12.1  Compliance with Laws. At its own expense, Boxlot shall comply with all applicable laws and regulations regarding providing and operating the Service. Without limiting the foregoing, Boxlot shall (a) obtain all governmental approval, permits and licenses, and make all governmental filings and registrations, necessary for the marketing and performance of the Service in every United States jurisdiction, (b) ensure that theglobe is not required to obtain any governmental approval, permits or licenses as a result of this Agreement, theglobe's performance hereunder or any payments made to theglobe hereunder, and (c) promptly resolve any assertions that the Service is illegal or violating a protected third party interest.
perturbation.changed_text: 12.1  Compliance with Laws. Boxlot shall comply with most applicable laws and regulations regarding providing and operating the Service. Without limiting the foregoing, Boxlot shall (a) obtain some governmental approval, permits and licenses, and make some governmental filings and registrations, necessary for the marketing and performance of the Service in some United States jurisdictions, (b) ensure that theglobe is not required to obtain any governmental approval, permits or licenses as a result of this Agreement, theglobe's performance hereunder or any payments made to theglobe hereunder, and (c) attempt to resolve any assertions that the Service is illegal or violating a protected third party interest.
perturbation.explanation: By weakening Boxlot's commitment to 'all' applicable laws and regulations, the contract now introduces ambiguity as to which laws Boxlot is obligated to follow. Specifically, by removing the word 'all' from some cases and replacing with the word 'some' and replacing prompt resolution with attempt to resolve, the contract may be interpreted as Boxlot only needing to comply with a subset of the relevant legal requirements and only needs to attempt to resolve issues which is contradictory to general legal standards which state that the company should comply with all laws and regulations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General standards for regulatory compliance and requirements to secure necessary licenses and permits.

perturbation.original_text: 2.8  User Relations.  Boxlot shall be responsible for providing all customer support regarding the Service or the Co-Branded Pages, and theglobe may redirect to Boxlot any associated customer support inquiries.  Boxlot shall have sole control over the user agreement that governs the Service, and Boxlot shall have the sole responsibility for dealing with breaches of such user agreement. However, if theglobe has an issue with the user agreement or Boxlot's enforcement of it, the parties shall discuss such issues in good faith. Furthermore, Boxlot's privacy policy shall make any disclosures, or obtain any User consent, reasonably requested by theglobe that the parties believe are necessary to make the disclosures about Users back to theglobe required by this Agreement.  All Users shall be treated at least as favorable in all respects (including without limitation with respect to pricing, quality of service, and customer support responsiveness) as Boxlot treats users of the Boxlot Site.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.8  User Relations.  Boxlot shall be responsible for providing most customer support regarding the Service or the Co-Branded Pages, and theglobe may redirect to Boxlot some associated customer support inquiries.  Boxlot shall have sole control over the user agreement that governs the Service, and Boxlot shall have some responsibility for dealing with breaches of such user agreement. However, if theglobe has an issue with the user agreement or Boxlot's enforcement of it, the parties shall discuss such issues in good faith. Furthermore, Boxlot's privacy policy may make disclosures, or obtain some User consent, that the parties believe are necessary to make the disclosures about Users back to theglobe required by this Agreement. Some Users may be treated as favorable in some respects (including without limitation with respect to pricing, quality of service, and customer support responsiveness) as Boxlot treats users of the Boxlot Site.
perturbation.explanation: By weakening Boxlot's commitment with the terms 'most', 'some', and 'may', the contract now introduces ambiguity as to their responsibility and how users shall be treated. The removal of 'all' and replacement with 'some' could suggest a lower standard for protection, potentially violating regulations and policies aimed at protecting consumer rights and privacy.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Consumer protection laws mandating equal treatment and privacy rights.

perturbation.original_text: 5.1  Rights/Restrictions.  Except as specified in this section, each party may freely use and disclose any information (both individual and aggregated) about Users ("User Data").  Neither party shall disclose any User Data in any manner that permits the User Data to be associated with the other party or permits the targeting of Users on the basis of their status as Users (in theglobe's case) or theglobe users (in Boxlot's case), nor shall a party use the User Data to target Users on the basis of their status as Users (in theglobe's case) or theglobe users (in Boxlot's case).  However, either party may disclose User Data if it is aggregated (in a non-associatable way) with data from multiple online properties.  Each party shall use and disclose User Data only in accordance with the privacy policy under which it was collected.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.1  Rights/Restrictions.  Except as specified in this section, each party may freely use and disclose any information (both individual and aggregated) about Users ("User Data").  Either party may disclose User Data in any manner that permits the User Data to be associated with the other party or permits the targeting of Users on the basis of their status as Users (in theglobe's case) or theglobe users (in Boxlot's case), and a party may use the User Data to target Users on the basis of their status as Users (in theglobe's case) or theglobe users (in Boxlot's case).  However, either party may disclose User Data if it is aggregated (in a non-associatable way) with data from multiple online properties.  Each party may use and disclose User Data in any way, regardless if its in accordance with the privacy policy under which it was collected.
perturbation.explanation: By removing "Neither party shall disclose any User Data in any manner that permits the User Data to be associated with the other party or permits the targeting of Users on the basis of their status as Users (in theglobe's case) or theglobe users (in Boxlot's case), nor shall a party use the User Data to target Users on the basis of their status as Users (in theglobe's case) or theglobe users (in Boxlot's case)", the agreement now permits the potential selling, or association of user data. By removing "only in accordance with the privacy policy under which it was collected", the agreement now ignores the privacy policy and regulations such as GDPR, CCPA.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Privacy laws such as GDPR and CCPA
